Industrialisasi Pertanian NTB Sudah Dimulai, Berwujud Benih Aneka Komoditas


KBRN, Lombok Utara : Gong industrialisasi pertanian di NTB sudah mulai ditabuh. Satu per satu, benih industri berwujud aneka komoditas mulai tumbuh. Di Lombok Utara, Gubernur NTB, Zulkieflimansyah menyaksikan sendiri bagaimana perkembangan menggembirakan yang berhasil disuguhkan oleh tumbuhnya industrialisasi di sektor pertanian.“Hari ini saya menyaksikan di Lombok Utara. Upaya ini mulai menunjukkan bahwa memang ada cahaya di ujung terowongan. Betapa tidak, petani-petani kecil berbinar matanya, bersinar wajahnya melihat tanah yang tadinya gersang dan kering kini hijau siap dipanen,” ujar Gubernur, Kamis (7/11/2019).Pernyataan itu disampaikan Gubernur usai melihat lahan pertanian jagung yang diairi dengan teknologi irigasi tetes alias drip irrigation. Setelah diterapkan, teknologi ini rupanya berhasil melipatgandakan produktivitas jagung di tanah kering tersebut.“Jagung yang tadinya hanya bisa dipanen sekali setahun, kini bisa minimal tiga kali setahun dengan hadirnya drip Irrigation dengan hasil tiga bahkan empat kali lipat,” paparnya.Gubernur meyakini, kesinambungan penanaman akan memungkinkan ketersediaan bahan baku untuk pakan ternak yang kemudian memajukan peternakan dan juga industri makanan di NTB. Terobosan ini sudah dimulai dari KLU. Selanjutkan, Gubernur bertekad untuk mereplikasi terobosan serupa di tanah-tanah kering lainnya di seluruh Pulau Lombok dan Pulau Sumbawa.Dalam berbagai kesempatan, Gubernur selalu menegaskan keyakinannya bahwa pengangguran dan kemiskinan akan bisa dikurangi dengan industrialisasi. Sebab, industrialisasi memungkinkan hadirnya peningkatan produktivitas. Komoditas yang tumbuh dari tanah-tanah di NTB, bisa menghasilkan nilai tambah berlipat ganda berkat industrialisasi.Konsep industrialisasi yang dimaksudkan Gubernur juga tidak selalu harus berupa hadirnya teknologi yang terlalu rumit atau berupa mesin-mesin besar. “Justru, yang akan didorong adalah lahirnya teknologi sederhana yang bisa mengolah hasil pertanian di NTB menjadi aneka produk olahan,” tuturnya.Setelah diolah, nilai komoditas NTB ini, tentu saja akan jauh lebih besar. Proses mengolah produk ini juga pasti membutuhkan tambahan tenaga kerja. Dalam skala satu atau beberapa unit, jumlah tenaga kerja yang terserap mungkin sedikit. Namun, jika teknologi sederhana ini diterapkan secara massal dalam bentuk sentra industri-industri rumahan di berbagai daerah di NTB, maka akumulasinya akan melahirkan kebutuhan tenaga kerja dalam jumlah yang besar.Berdasarkan data terakhir yang dipublikasikan Badan Pusat Statistik NTB, laju pertumbuhan industri pengolahan di NTB pada triwulan ketiga 2019 hanya mencapai 1,18 persen (y on y). Data ini memperlihatkan bahwa industri pengolahan belum mencapai laju pertumbuhan yang diharapkan. Untuk itulah, Gubernur menegaskan perlunya semua pihak terus berupaya mendorong tumbuhnya industri-industri pengolahan di NTB.Meski sulit, Gubernur meyakini langkah ini adalah sesuatu yang harus ditempuh oleh masyarakat NTB. “Perjalanan panjang, memang harus dimulai dengan langkah pertama,” pungkasnya.

NTB Agricultural Industrialization Has Begun, Intangible Various Commodity Seeds

NTB Agricultural Industrialization Has Begun, Intangible Various Commodity Seeds


KBRN, North Lombok: Gong of agricultural industrialization in NTB has begun to beating. One by one, the seeds of various tangible industrial commodities began to grow. In North Lombok, the Governor of NTB, Zulkieflimansyah witnessed firsthand how exciting developments that had been successfully presented by the growth of industrialization in the agricultural sector. "Today I witnessed in North Lombok. This effort began to show that there was indeed light at the end of the tunnel. Imagine, small farmers sparkle eyes, shine their faces to see the land that was barren and dry is now green ready to be harvested, "said the Governor, Thursday (11/07/2019). The statement was conveyed by the Governor after seeing the corn farm irrigated with technology drip irrigation. After being applied, this technology apparently succeeded in doubling the productivity of corn in the dry land. "Corn which was only able to be harvested once a year, can now be at least three times a year with the presence of drip Irrigation with three or even quadruple results," he explained. The governor believes, sustainability planting will allow the availability of raw material for animal feed which then advances livestock and also the food industry in NTB. This breakthrough has started from KLU. Furthermore, the Governor is determined to replicate similar breakthroughs in other dry lands throughout Lombok and Sumbawa. On various occasions, the Governor has always stressed his belief that unemployment and poverty can be reduced by industrialization. Because, industrialization allows the presence of increased productivity. Commodities that grow from lands in NTB, can generate multiple added values thanks to industrialization. The concept of industrialization meant by the Governor also does not necessarily have to be the presence of technology that is too complicated or in the form of large machinery. "In fact, what will be encouraged is the birth of simple technology that can process agricultural products in NTB into various processed products," he said. After being processed, the value of NTB's commodities, of course, will be much greater. The process of processing this product also definitely requires additional labor. On a scale of one or several units, the amount of labor absorbed may be small. However, if this simple technology is applied en masse in the form of home industry centers in various regions in NTB, then its accumulation will give birth to a large number of labor needs. Based on the latest data published by the Central Statistics Agency of NTB, the growth rate of the processing industry in NTB in the third quarter of 2019 it only reached 1.18 percent (y on y). This data shows that the processing industry has not reached the expected growth rate. For this reason, the Governor stressed the need for all parties to continue to encourage the growth of the processing industries in NTB. Even though it is difficult, the Governor believes this step is something that must be taken by the people of NTB. "The journey is long, indeed it must start with the first step," he concluded.
